summary: This is an internal email chain among US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) staff discussing upcoming case-related events for the week of January 18, 2020. It references scheduling for the Avenatti case before Judge Gardephe, a moot court, a DAG visit, and a meeting with an attorney.

persons.name: Avenatti
persons.context: Referenced as having a conference before Judge Gardephe, marking his first appearance since his arrest, with a trial date expected to be set.

persons.name: Judge Gardephe
persons.context: Presiding over a conference in the Avenatti case, expected to set a trial date for January 27, 2020.

persons.name: DAG
persons.context: A visit from the Deputy Attorney General is scheduled, with presentations from PC (likely a person or group) to GEP/AOC.

connections.description: Judge Gardephe is presiding over a conference in Avenatti's case, setting a trial date.
MA is referenced in the context of Avenatti's case, suggesting MA is likely Michael Avenatti.

events.title: Conference in Avenatti case before Judge Gardephe
events.description: A conference is scheduled in the Avenatti case before Judge Gardephe, marking Avenatti's first appearance since his arrest. A trial date of January 27 is expected to be set.

events.title: Rescheduled moot of opening in Avenatti

keyFacts: The email discusses scheduling for the Avenatti case, indicating ongoing legal proceedings in early 2020.
Avenatti's first appearance since his arrest is noted, with a trial date expected to be set for January 27, 2020.
The email references internal preparations at the US Attorney's Office, including a moot court and a DAG visit.
The correspondence is among USANYS staff, showing coordination on multiple cases and administrative matters.
